detaileddescription.para: Transmit acceptance based in the order(prio)
Transmit acceptance filtering is based on the CAN identifier
Transmit acceptance based in the order
Defines arbitration mode for transmit acceptance filtering. Use type XMC_CAN_ARBITRATION_MODE_t for this enum.
Use peripheral clock as MCAN baudrate generator input clock.

Use high performance oscillator (fOHP) as MCAN baudrate generator input clock.
Only available for XMC1400, XMC4800 and XMC4700 series
Defines the Clock source used for the MCAN baudrate generator
Defines the Divider Modes. Use type XMC_CAN_DM_t for this enum.
The frame counter is incremented with the beginning of a new bit time
Used for baud rate detection and analysis of the bit timing
Defines the operation mode of the frame counter. Use type XMC_CAN_FRAME_COUNT_MODE_t for this enum.
Defines Data frame types. Use type XMC_CAN_FRAME_TYPE_t for this enum.
Each CAN node can be connected to the internal CAN bus
Each CAN node can be connected to the external CAN bus
Defines loop Back Mode, to enable/disable an in-system test of the MultiCAN module . Use type XMC_CAN_LOOKBACKMODE_t for this enum.
Defines mask value for CAN Message Object event type. Use type XMC_CAN_MO_EVENT_t for this enum.
Defines CAN Message Object event node pointer position. Use type XMC_CAN_MO_POINTER_EVENT_t for this enum.
Defines mask value for CAN Message Object reset status. Use type XMC_CAN_MO_RESET_STATUS_t for this enum.
Defines mask value for CAN Message Object set status. Use type XMC_CAN_MO_SET_STATUS_t for this enum.
Defines message has been successfully received or not received
Defines message has been successfully transmitted or not transmitted
Defines Message identifier, DLC, and data of the message object are currently updated or not updated
Defines no update of the message object since last flag reset or Message object has been updated
CAN message is lost because NEWDAT has become set again when it has already been set or No CAN message is lost
Defines mask value for CAN Message Object status. Use type XMC_CAN_MO_STATUS_t for this enum.
Defines Message Object direction. Use type XMC_CAN_MO_TYPE_t for this enum.
Defines mask value for CAN Node control like initialization, node disable and analyzer mode . Use type XMC_CAN_NODE_CONTROL_t for this enum.
Defines mask value for CAN Node events. Use type XMC_CAN_NODE_EVENT_t for this enum.
Defines interrupt request on interrupt output line INT_O[n]. Use type XMC_CAN_NODE_INTERRUPT_TRIGGER_t for this enum.
The last error occurred while the CAN node x was receiver
The last error occurred while the CAN node x was transmitter
Defines last error transfer direction. Use type XMC_CAN_NODE_LAST_ERROR_DIR_t for this enum.
The last error led to an error counter increment of 1.
The last error led to an error counter increment of 8.
Defines last error increment. Use type XMC_CAN_NODE_LAST_ERROR_INC_t for this enum.
Last Error code Event node pointer
CAN Frame Count Event node pointer
Defines mask value for CAN node pointer events position. Use type XMC_CAN_NODE_POINTER_EVENT_t for this enum.
Defines the possible receive inputs. Use type XMC_CAN_NODE_RECEIVE_INPUT_t for this enum.
Defines mask value for CAN Node status. Use type XMC_CAN_NODE_STATUS_t for this enum.
Remove a message object from the list and insert it before a given object.
Defines CAN module Panel Commands . Use type XMC_CAN_PANCMD_t for this enum.
Driver is busy and can not handle request
Returned if Message object is disabled
Defines the status of CAN, to verify the CAN related API calls. Use type XMC_CAN_STATUS_t for this enum.
Defines Node Runtime structure.pointer to the Node CAN register

memberdef.argsstring: (XMC_CAN_t *const obj, const uint8_t node_num, const uint8_t mo_num)
memberdef.name: XMC_CAN_AllocateMOtoNodeList

parameterdescription.para: Pointer pointing to XMC_CAN Global Initialization structure. Defines CAN global registers,refer CAN_NODE_TypeDef for details.
CAN node number,Range : 0-2
CAN Message Object number,Range : 0-63

simplesect.para: None

simplesect.title: Description:
simplesect.para: Allocates Message Object from free list to node list. Each node_num is linked to one unique list of message objects. A CAN node performs message transfer only with the mo_num message objects that are allocated to the list of the CAN node. It configures PANCTR register.

simplesect.title: Related APIs:
simplesect.para: None

parameterdescription.para: Pointer pointing to XMC_CAN Global Initialization structure. Defines CAN global registers,refer CAN_NODE_TypeDef for details.

simplesect.para: None

simplesect.title: Description:
simplesect.para: Disables CAN module. In disabled state, no registers of CAN module can be read or written except the CAN_CLC register.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer pointing to XMC_CAN Global Initialization structure. Defines CAN global registers,refer CAN_NODE_TypeDef for details.

simplesect.para: None

simplesect.title: Description:
simplesect.para: Enables CAN module and initializes all CAN registers to reset values. It is required to re-configure desired CAN nodes, before any data transfer. It configures CAN_CLC.DISR bit.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer pointing to XMC_CAN Global Initialization structure. Defines CAN global registers,refer CAN_NODE_TypeDef for details.
Interrupt trigger number selection. Refer XMC_CAN_NODE_INTERRUPT_TRIGGER_t for valid values. Multiple interrupt trigger events can be ORed.

simplesect.para: None

simplesect.title: Description:
simplesect.para: Configures multiple interrupt requests with a single write operation. service_requestr represents single interrupt request or multiple.It configures MITR register.

simplesect.title: Related APIs:
simplesect.para: None

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to Message Object structure. Refer XMC_CAN_MO_t data structure for details.

simplesect.para: None

simplesect.title: Description:
simplesect.para: Configuration allows to disable the FIFO Foreign Remote Request. TXRQ of message object n is set on reception of a matching Remote Frame. It configures MOFCR.FRREN register.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to Message Object structure. Refer XMC_CAN_MO_t data structure for details.

simplesect.para: None

simplesect.title: Description:
simplesect.para: Configuration allows to disable the FIFO Remote Monitoring. This Specifies Identifier, Identifier Extension bit, and DLC of message object n remain unchanged upon the reception of a matching Remote Frame. It configures MOFCR.RMM bit.

simplesect.title: Note:
simplesect.para: Remote monitoring(RMM) applies only to transmit objects and has no effect on receive objects.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to Message Object structure. Refer XMC_CAN_MO_t data structure for details.

simplesect.para: None

simplesect.title: Description:
simplesect.para: Configuration allows to disable the Single Data Transfer of the FIFO Message Object, with this configuration bit MSGVAL is not affected. It configures MOFCR.SDT bit.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to Message Object structure. Refer XMC_CAN_MO_t data structure for details.

simplesect.para: None

simplesect.title: Description:
simplesect.para: Configuration allows to enable the FIFO Foreign Remote Request. This Specifies TXRQ of the message object referenced by the pointer CUR is set on reception of a matching Remote Frame. It configures MOFCR.FRREN register.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to Message Object structure. Refer XMC_CAN_MO_t data structure for details.

simplesect.para: None

simplesect.title: Description:
simplesect.para: Configuration allows to enable the FIFO Remote Monitoring. This Specifies identifier, IDE(Identifier Extension) bit, and DLC of a matching Remote Frame are copied to transmit object n in order to monitor incoming Remote Frames. It configures MOFCR.RMM bit.

simplesect.title: Note:
simplesect.para: Remote monitoring(RMM) applies only to transmit objects and has no effect on receive objects.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to Message Object structure. Refer XMC_CAN_MO_t data structure for details.

simplesect.para: None

simplesect.title: Description:
simplesect.para: Configuration allows to enable the Single Data Transfer of the FIFO Message Object. If SDT = 1 and message object n is not a FIFO base object, then MSGVAL is reset when this object has taken part in a successful data transfer (receive or transmit). If SDT = 1 and message object n is a FIFO base object, then MSGVAL is reset when the pointer to the current object CUR reaches the value of SEL in the FIFO/Gateway Pointer Register. It configures MOFCR.SDT bit.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to Message Object structure. Refer XMC_CAN_MO_t data structure for details.

simplesect.para: uint8_t Current Message Object Number. Range:0-63

simplesect.title: Description:
simplesect.para: Returns the current FIFO Message Object,points to the actual target object within a FIFO/Gateway structure.

simplesect.para: None

Selected Message Object number. Range:0-63

simplesect.para: None

simplesect.title: Description:
simplesect.para: Set Object Select Pointer. If the current pointer CUR of FIFO base object becomes equal select_pointer, a FIFO overflow interrupt request is generated. Used for FIFO monitoring purpose.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer pointing to XMC_CAN Global Initialization structure. Defines CAN global registers,refer CAN_NODE_TypeDef for details.
CAN module frequency clock source.
CAN module frequency(fCAN). Max. value: Max. clock source frequency, i.e. if using fOHP and using a XTAL of 20MHz then fCAN max. value is 20MHz.

simplesect.para: Use clksrc parameter only for XMC1400 series and XMC47/4800 series projects, otherwise omit this parameter.
None

simplesect.title: Description:
simplesect.para: Configures clock rate of the module timer clock fCAN. Altering CAN module can_frequency shall affects baud rate, call XMC_CAN_NODE_NominalBitTimeConfigure() or XMC_CAN_NODE_NominalBitTimeConfigureEx() to configure baud rate for current CAN frequency. It configures FDR register.
Use XMC_CAN_InitEx() for new projects. XMC_CAN_Init() is kept for backward compatibility reasons.

simplesect.title: Related APIs:
simplesect.para: XMC_CAN_NODE_NominalBitTimeConfigure(), XMC_CAN_NODE_NominalBitTimeConfigureEx(), XMC_CAN_InitEx()

detaileddescription.para:
obj
Pointer pointing to XMC_CAN Global Initialization structure. Defines CAN global registers,refer CAN_NODE_TypeDef for details.
clksrc
CAN module frequency clock source
can_frequency
CAN module frequency(fCAN). The can_frequency shall be an integer divisor of the CAN clock source frequency (fPERI/fMCLK or fOHP) and it should be selected such that if fulfills the minimum operating frequency specified in the clock control section of the reference manual. In addition the can_frequency shall be an integer multiple of the baudrate. Max. value: Max. clock source frequency, i.e. if using fOHP and using a XTAL of 20MHz then fCAN max. value is 20MHz.
Actual frequency
Description:
Similar to XMC_CAN_Init() configures clock rate of the module timer clock fCAN. The difference being that only the normal divider is used to avoid jitter. In addition the actual achievable frequency is returned.
Use XMC_CAN_InitEx() for new projects. XMC_CAN_Init() is kept for backward compatibility reasons.
Altering CAN module can_frequency shall affects baud rate, call XMC_CAN_NODE_NominalBitTimeConfigureEx() to configure baud rate for current CAN frequency. It configures FDR register.

simplesect.title: Related APIs:
simplesect.para: XMC_CAN_NODE_NominalBitTimeConfigure(), XMC_CAN_NODE_NominalBitTimeConfigureEx()

parameterdescription.para: Pointer pointing to XMC_CAN Global Initialization structure

simplesect.title: Description:
simplesect.para: Disable Node Loop-Back Mode, disables internal (virtual) loop-back CAN bus. This API Configures NPCRx register. Call XMC_CAN_NODE_EnableConfigurationChange() API before NPCRx configuration, same way XMC_CAN_NODE_DisableConfigurationChange() API after NPCRx configuration.

simplesect.title: Note:
simplesect.para: NPCRx can be written only if bit NCRx.CCE is set.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer Pointing to CAN_NODE Structure. Defines CAN_NODE registers, Range :CAN_NODE0-CAN_NODE2.

simplesect.title: Description:

simplesect.title: Related API's:
simplesect.para: None

parameterdescription.para: Pointer Pointing to CAN_NODE Structure. Defines CAN_NODE registers, Range :CAN_NODE0-CAN_NODE2.

simplesect.para: None

simplesect.title: Description:
simplesect.para: Allow to change the configuration of the CAN node, like bit timing, CAN bus transmit/receive ports and error counters read. It configures NCRx.CCE bit.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer Pointing to CAN_NODE Structure. Defines CAN_NODE registers, Range :CAN_NODE0-CAN_NODE2.
CAN node event mask value. Refer XMC_CAN_NODE_EVENT_t structure for valid values. multiple events can be ORed.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer Pointing to CAN_NODE Structure. Defines CAN_NODE registers, Range :CAN_NODE0-CAN_NODE2.

simplesect.para: None

simplesect.title: Description:
simplesect.para: Enable Node can_node in Loop-Back Mode. A Node is connected to an internal (virtual) loop-back CAN bus. All CAN nodes which are in Loop- Back Mode are connected to this virtual CAN bus so that they can communicate with each other internally. The external transmit line is forced recessive in Loop-Back Mode. This API Configures NPCRx register. call XMC_CAN_NODE_EnableConfigurationChange() API before NPCRx configuration, same way XMC_CAN_NODE_DisableConfigurationChange() API after NPCRx configuration configuration.

simplesect.title: Related APIs:]
simplesect.para: XMC_CAN_NODE_DisableLoopBack().

simplesect.title: Note:
simplesect.para: NPCRx can be written only if bit NCRx.CCE is set.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer Pointing to CAN_NODE Structure. Defines CAN_NODE registers, Range :CAN_NODE0-CAN_NODE2.

simplesect.para: None

simplesect.title: Description:
simplesect.para: Trigger the suspension of the CAN node. An OCDS(on chip debug support) suspend trigger disables the CAN node: As soon as the CAN node becomes bus-idle or bus-off, bit INIT is internally forced to 1 to disable the CAN node. The actual value of bit INIT remains unchanged. It configures NCR.SUSEN bit

simplesect.title: Related API's:
simplesect.para: None

simplesect.title: Note:
simplesect.para: Bit SUSEN is reset via OCDS(on chip debug support) Reset.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer Pointing to CAN_NODE Structure. Defines CAN_NODE registers, Range :CAN_NODE0-CAN_NODE2.
frame counter mode selection. Refer XMC_CAN_NODE_FRAME_COUNTER_t for valid values.

simplesect.para: None

simplesect.title: Description:
simplesect.para: Configures frame counter functions. Each CAN can_node is equipped with a frame counter that counts transmitted/received CAN frames or obtains information about the time when a frame has been started to transmit or be received by the CAN node. It configures NFCR register.

simplesect.title: Related API's:
simplesect.para: None

parameterdescription.para: Pointer Pointing to CAN_NODE Structure. Defines CAN_NODE registers, Range :CAN_NODE0-CAN_NODE2.

simplesect.para: uint16_t current value of the CAN frame counter. Range :0-65535

simplesect.title: Description:
simplesect.para: Returns the frame counter value can_node of the CAN node. In Frame Count Mode (CFMOD = 00B), this API returns the frame count value. In Time Stamp Mode (CFMOD = 01B), this API returns the captured bit time count value, captured with the start of a new frame. In all Bit Timing Analysis Modes (CFMOD = 10B), this API always returns the number of fCLC clock cycles (measurement result) minus 1.

simplesect.title: Related API's:
simplesect.para: None

parameterdescription.para: Pointer Pointing to CAN_NODE Structure. Defines CAN_NODE registers, Range :CAN_NODE0-CAN_NODE2.

simplesect.para: uint8_t Error Warning Level. Range :0 - 255

simplesect.title: Description:
simplesect.para: Returns error warning level. This determines the threshold value (warning level, default 96) to be reached in order to set the corresponding error warning bit EWRN. It reads NECNT register.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer Pointing to CAN_NODE Structure. Defines CAN_NODE registers, Range :CAN_NODE0-CAN_NODE2.

simplesect.para: XMC_CAN_NODE_LAST_ERROR_DIR_t Last error transfer direction. Refer XMC_CAN_NODE_LAST_ERROR_DIR_t.

simplesect.title: Description:
simplesect.para: Returns NODE Last Error occurred during Transmit/receive direction. It returns value of NFCR register.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer Pointing to CAN_NODE Structure. Defines CAN_NODE registers, Range :CAN_NODE0-CAN_NODE2.

simplesect.para: XMC_CAN_NODE_LAST_ERROR_INC_t Last error transfer increment. Refer XMC_CAN_NODE_LAST_ERROR_INC_t.

simplesect.title: Description:
simplesect.para: Returns NODE Last Error Transfer Increment. It returns value of NFCR register.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer Pointing to CAN_NODE Structure. Defines CAN_NODE registers, Range :CAN_NODE0-CAN_NODE2.

simplesect.para: uint8_t receive error counter value.

simplesect.title: Description:
simplesect.para: Returns Receive Error Counter value. It reads NECNT register.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer Pointing to CAN_NODE Structure. Defines CAN_NODE registers, Range :CAN_NODE0-CAN_NODE2.

simplesect.para: uint32_t Current status of the node.

simplesect.title: Description:
simplesect.para: Returns errors status as well as successfully transferred CAN frames status.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer Pointing to CAN_NODE Structure. Defines CAN_NODE registers, Range :CAN_NODE0-CAN_NODE2.

simplesect.para: uint8_t transmit error counter value. Range :0 - 255

simplesect.title: Description:
simplesect.para: Returns Transmit Error Counter value. If the Bitstream Processor detects an error while a transmit operation is running, the Transmit Error Counter is incremented by 8. An increment of 1 is used when the error condition was reported by an external CAN node via an Error Frame generation. It reads NECNT register.

simplesect.title: Note:
simplesect.para: NECNTx can be written only if bit NCRx.CCE is set.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer pointing to CAN_NODE Structure. Defines CAN_NODE registers. Range :CAN_NODE0-CAN_NODE2
Nominal bit time configuration data structure. Refer XMC_CAN_NODE_NOMINAL_BIT_TIME_CONFIG_t for details.

simplesect.para: None

simplesect.title: Description:
simplesect.para: Configures CAN node Baudrate. can_bit_time specifies required baudrate for a specified can_node. It configures NBTR register.

simplesect.title: Related APIs:
simplesect.para: None

detaileddescription.para:
can_node
Pointer pointing to CAN_NODE Structure. Defines CAN_NODE registers. Range :CAN_NODE0-CAN_NODE2
can_bit_time
Nominal bit time configuration data structure. Refer XMC_CAN_NODE_NOMINAL_BIT_TIME_CONFIG_t for details.
Status on the sucess setting the desired bitrate XMC_CAN_STATUS_t
Description:
Similar to XMC_CAN_NODE_NominalBitTimeConfigure() configures the CAN node baudrate. The difference being that allows bitrates below 100kpbs.
Consider using the new API for new projects. XMC_CAN_NODE_NominalBitTimeConfigure() is kept for backward compatibility reasons.
Configures CAN node Baudrate. can_bit_time specifies required baudrate for a specified can_node. It configures NBTR register.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer Pointing to CAN_NODE Structure. Defines CAN_NODE registers, Range :CAN_NODE0-CAN_NODE2.

simplesect.para: None

simplesect.title: Description:
simplesect.para: Reset the Analyzer mode. CAN node is no more in Analyzer Mode. Please refer XMC_CAN_NODE_SetAnalyzerMode(). It configures NCR.CALM bit. XMC_CAN_NODE_SetInitBit() should be called before set / reset AnalyzerMode.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer Pointing to CAN_NODE Structure. Defines CAN_NODE registers, Range :CAN_NODE0-CAN_NODE2.

simplesect.para: None

simplesect.title: Description:
simplesect.para: Enable CAN node participation in CAN traffic. Bit INIT is automatically set when the CAN node enters the bus-off state. It configures NCR.INIT bit.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer Pointing to CAN_NODE Structure. Defines CAN_NODE registers, Range :CAN_NODE0-CAN_NODE2.

simplesect.para: None

simplesect.title: Description:
simplesect.para: Configure CAN node in Analyzer Mode. This means that messages may be received, but not transmitted. No acknowledge is sent on the CAN bus upon frame reception. Active-error flags are sent recessive instead of dominant. The transmit line is continuously held at recessive (1) level. XMC_CAN_NODE_SetInitBit() should be called before set / reset AnalyzerMode. It configures NCR.CALM bit.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer Pointing to CAN_NODE Structure. Defines CAN_NODE registers, Range :CAN_NODE0-CAN_NODE2.
Error Warning level value. Range :0-255.

simplesect.para: None

simplesect.title: Description:
simplesect.para: Configures error warning level in order to set the corresponding error warning bit EWRN. It configures error_warning_level into NECNT register. Before this configuration call XMC_CAN_NODE_EnableConfigurationChange() API.

simplesect.title: Note:
simplesect.para: NECNTx can be written only if bit NCRx.CCE is set.

Interrupt service request number. Range : 0-7

simplesect.title: Description:
simplesect.para: Disable CAN node participation in CAN traffic. Bit INIT is automatically set when the CAN node enters the bus-off state. It configures NCR.INIT bit.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer Pointing to CAN_NODE Structure. Defines CAN_NODE registers, Range :CAN_NODE0-CAN_NODE2.
receive error counter value. Range :0-255

simplesect.para: None

simplesect.title: Description:
simplesect.para: Configures Receive Error Counter. It configures can_rec into NECNT register. Before this configuration call XMC_CAN_NODE_EnableConfigurationChange() API.

simplesect.title: Note:
simplesect.para: NECNTx can be written only if bit NCRx.CCE is set.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer pointing to CAN_NODE Structure. Defines CAN_NODE registers, Range :CAN_NODE0-CAN_NODE2.
CAN receive input selection. Refer XMC_CAN_NODE_RECEIVE_INPUT_t for details.

simplesect.para: None

simplesect.title: Description:
simplesect.para: input specifies CAN input receive pin. This API Configures NPCRx register,it is required to call XMC_CAN_NODE_EnableConfigurationChange(), before configuring NPCRx register, call XMC_CAN_NODE_DisableConfigurationChange() API after configuring NPCRx register. CAN input receive pins which falls under analog port pins should call XMC_GPIO_EnableDigitalInput(),to enable digital pad.

simplesect.title: Related APIs:
simplesect.para: None

simplesect.title: Note:
simplesect.para: NPCRx can be written only if bit NCRx.CCE is set.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer Pointing to CAN_NODE Structure. Defines CAN_NODE registers, Range :CAN_NODE0-CAN_NODE2.
transmit error counter value. Range :0-255

simplesect.para: None

simplesect.title: Description:

simplesect.title: Note:

memberdef.argsstring: (XMC_CAN_t *const obj, const XMC_CAN_PANCMD_t pancmd, const uint8_t arg1, const uint8_t arg2)
memberdef.name: XMC_CAN_PanelControl

parameterdescription.para: Pointer pointing to XMC_CAN Global Initialization structure. Defines CAN global registers,refer CAN_NODE_TypeDef for details.
panal command selection. Refer XMC_CAN_PANCMD_t for valid values.
Panel Argument 1,Range : 0-2
Panel Argument 2, Range : 0-63

simplesect.para: None

simplesect.title: Description:
simplesect.para: Configures the panel command and panel arguments. A panel operation consists of a command code (PANCMD) and up to two panel arguments (PANAR1, PANAR2). Commands that have a return value deliver it to the PANAR1 bit field. Commands that return an error flag deliver it to bit 31 of the Panel Control Register, this means bit 7 of PANAR2. arg1 represents panel argument PANAR1,arg2 represents panel argument PANAR2 and pancmd represents command code. It configures PANCTR register.

simplesect.title: Related APIs:
simplesect.para: None

simplesect.title: Description:
simplesect.para: To transmit Message Object from the FIFO. Prior to this CAN node Message Object FIFO structure shall be made using XMC_CAN_TXFIFO_ConfigMOBaseObject(), XMC_CAN_TXFIFO_ConfigMOSlaveObject(),XMC_CAN_RXFIFO_ConfigMOBaseObject() API's. Please refer reference manual MessageObject FIFOStructure for more info.

briefdescription.para: Controller Area Network Controller (CAN) driver for the XMC microcontroller family.

detaileddescription.para: CAN driver provides transfer of CAN frames in accordance with CAN specificetion V2.0 B (active). Each CAN node can receive and transmit standard frames with 11-bit identifiers as well as extended frames with 29-bit identifiers. All CAN nodes share a common set of message objects. Each message object can be individually allocated to one of the CAN nodes. Besides serving as a storage container for incoming and outgoing frames, message objects can be combined to build gateways between the CAN nodes or to setup a FIFO buffer. The CAN module provides Analyzer mode,Loop-back mode and bit timming for node analysis.

The driver is divided into five sections: CAN Global features:
Allows to configure module frequency using function XMC_CAN_Init().
Allows to configure Module interrupt using configuration structure XMC_CAN_NODE_INTERRUPT_TRIGGER_t and function XMC_CAN_EventTrigger().
CAN_NODE features:
Allows to set baud rate by configuration structure XMC_CAN_NODE_NOMINAL_BIT_TIME_CONFIG_t and Baudrate Configuration function XMC_CAN_NODE_NominalBitTimeConfigure().
Allows to configure loop-back mode using fuction XMC_CAN_NODE_EnableLoopBack().
Allows to configure CAN Node analyzer using function XMC_CAN_NODE_SetAnalyzerMode().
Allows CAN node events enable/ disable by enum structure XMC_CAN_NODE_EVENT_t and functions XMC_CAN_NODE_EnableEvent() and XMC_CAN_NODE_DisableEvent().
Provides bit timming analysis, configuration structure XMC_CAN_NODE_FRAME_COUNTER_t and function XMC_CAN_NODE_FrameCounterConfigure().
CAN_MO features:
Allows message object initialization by configuration structure XMC_CAN_MO_t and function XMC_CAN_MO_Config().
Allows transfer of message objects using functions XMC_CAN_MO_Transmit() and XMC_CAN_MO_Receive().
Allows to configure Single Data Transfer and Single Transmit Trial using functions XMC_CAN_MO_EnableSingleTransmitTrial() and XMC_CAN_MO_EnableSingleTransmitTrial().
Allows to configure MO events using function XMC_CAN_MO_EnableEvent().
CAN_FIFO features:
Allows message object FIFO structure by configuration structure XMC_CAN_FIFO_CONFIG_t and functions XMC_CAN_TXFIFO_ConfigMOBaseObject() , XMC_CAN_RXFIFO_ConfigMOBaseObject() and XMC_CAN_TXFIFO_Transmit().
CAN_GATEWAY features:
Provides Gateway mode, configuration structure XMC_CAN_GATEWAY_CONFIG_t and function XMC_CAN_GATEWAY_InitSourceObject().
